Class WinnerCheck

  • java.lang.Object
    • WinnerCheck
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TicTacToe
    class WinnerCheck
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for checking if the recent move has won the game. Class has methods to check rows, columns and diagonals for victory. It takes the last input from either player or computer and checks around it.

      • isWinner

        public void isWinner​(java.lang.String[][] gameField,
                     int r,
                     int c)
        Takes the row and column coordinates of the last move made and checks to see if that move was a winning one.
        Parameters:
        gameField - 2d array where the game is played.
        r - Row coordinate for the last move.
        c - Rolumn coordinate for the last move.

        public void checkColumns​(java.lang.String[][] gameField,

        Checks the column around the last placed mark for victory

        column - Column coordinate for the last move.

      • checkDiagonalLeftToRight

        public void checkDiagonalLeftToRight​(java.lang.String[][] gameField,
                                     int row,
                                     int column)
        Diagonal win check from left to right around the last move. First it moves towards top left and counts how many in a row. After either edge of array or non current moved string is found it returns to the original point and changes direction.
        Parameters:
        gameField - 2d array where the game is played.
        row - Row coordinate for the last move.
        column - Column coordinate for the last move.

      • checkDiagonalRightToLeft

        public void checkDiagonalRightToLeft​(java.lang.String[][] gameField,
                                     int row,
                                     int column)
        Diagonal win check from right to left around the last move. First it moves towards top right and counts how many in a row. After either edge of array or non current moved string is found it returns to the original point and changes direction.
        Parameters:
        gameField - 2d array where the game is played.
        row - Row coordinate for the last move.
        column - Column coordinate for the last move.

        public void setCounter​(int value)
